column1: == Government ==
=== Local ===
Napier has been governed by Napier City Council since 1950.

Local government reform was mooted in the late 1990s and a referendum was held in 1999 proposing an amalgamation of the Hastings District Council with the Napier City Council. Although supported by approximately two-thirds of Hastings voters
column2: Napier voters rejected the proposal by a similar number and the proposal was defeated.

column1: The National Government amended the Local Government Act in 2012 to determine a reorganisation proposal by a majority vote over the entire proposed area
column2: rather than a majority over each existing area as was previously the case. Yet another change was to allow private submissions to the commission to trigger the process
column3: whereas previously only local councils themselves could request a change in structure or boundary. The legislative restrictions on councils using public funds to support or challenge a final proposal did not apply to private lobby groups or individuals however.

column3: Hastings District Council and Central Hawke's Bay District Council to form a proposed 'Hawke's Bay Council'. A postal ballot was established to maximise voter returns
